reviews.text: Installed today so don't know how well this product does in the long term. However, in the short term... The switch was covered in the box so it would not get scratched by other pieces in the box. Was easy to install. Just make sure you know which are the hot and neutral wires when connecting this device to power. Only one complaint--instructions did not say what size drill bit was needed to install anchors in sheet rock. I used anchors that I already had and knew the size drill bit needed.

reviews.title: Worked exactly as described.

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: Update: After my review, customer service contacted me and gave me a refund. Well done on that front so I'll add 2 more stars. Doesn't make me think any better of the product, but it's handled by good people. Maybe I just had a dud given the other positive comments; however, it's not a product I recommend. Original review: Complete waste of money. Worked intermittently. Sometimes it would click on immediately, other times very slowly, then other times not at all. And it's not like you can trouble shoot in an app. You simply have no idea why it's not working. Unfortunately, I ordered a couple weeks before it was actually installed in my new light, and by the time I'd had 2 weeks of it not working as expected and getting fed up and removing it, it's outside the return window. Don't make the same mistake. Don't buy.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2025
reviews.title: Good customer service but questionable product

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: I installed this for a simple garage light near a back entry. It works intermittenly. Most of the time you can get it to turn on after a few trys but turning it off seems to be the real problem. I installed the switch only 12 feet away from the reciever but it does not work consistently. Its a particularly frustrating when trying to shut things down for the night and your there trying to turn it off over and over. I moved it to 8 feet away and it still could not work as advertized. Making a remote light switch is not a new technology and should not be a difficult task for a decently equipped company. Don't waste your money get a better brand.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2025
reviews.title: Frustrating waste of money

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: READ THIS TROUBLESHOOTING TIP: If after installing the wireless switch to control a light fixture it turns ON but not OFF or it requires many pushes off etc. AND you are using an LED light bulb, remove the LED bulb and try an incandescent bulb. If it is now reliable and you still want to use an LED purchase a "dimmable" bulb. I've had good luck with Phillips bulbs. These are semiconductor switches and there is a technical reason they don't work well with LED bulbs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025
reviews.title: Troubleshooting

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: I have a light switch that is inconveniently located in a bookcase and is covered by books. I did not want to relocate this light switch, so I bought this remote light switch so I could access the covered switch. This remote works great! It has a low profile so while it does not lay flat like a normally installed light switch, it only protrudes about 1/2” but doesn’t look out of place. The transmitter needed to be hard wired in place of my covered switch, but if you know how to install an outlet or switch, it is very easy to do. You will want a face plate to cover the transmitter.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2024
reviews.title: Easy to install, works great

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: Easy install and setup. Rectangular box is perfect size to conceal inside light fixture. Didn’t read instructions and installed in no time. Included hardware is all you need for installation. Love the movable switch. Excellent for upgrading basement fixtures with pull chains and eliminate extra electrical wiring and switches. Also gives flexibility to place switch wherever you want without cutting sheet rock, walls, or wall studs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2024
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: I bought 4 of these with the goal of being able to remotely operate four fixtures. I installed the first, and found it worked intermittently. It could turn the light on and off, much of the time, but often required multiple attempts. Occasionally, it would not operate at all. Since I intended to install four switches, I decided to try a second one, and maybe it would work perfectly. But it worked more or less like the first switch. Operations succeeded intermittently, but failures were not identical to the failures of the first switch. Then I looked at the reviews more carefully. Reviews ranking the product from 1 to 3 stars almost always cited the intermittent behavior. This convinced me that the product design was inherently at fault. I returned all four switches, including two remaining that I not bothered to open and test. I wanted remote switches that worked perfectly. Intermittent behavior is not acceptable. My recommendation is to avoid this product until a new product replaces this one, and the new product corrects the intermittent failures of the present product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviews.title: Switch works intermittently

I got the 15A just to be safe even tho it will stay way below that with LED bulbs. At first I installed it backwards with the load to the black wire but on this device the red goes to the load blue to N

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: Our new shop is in a very old building, built by leprechauns apparently as all the light switches were a foot off the ground. I'm 6'2". I was not going to be bending over for every light switch for eternity and needing to stretch and touch my toes every morning before I could turn the lights on at worm. Every switch got replaced with these. Miracle workers! We even were able to put 2 in the ceiling at the junction box and split up some of the lights, so I can have all the main room lights on at once or only half. These are amazing and surprisingly simple to install and program to the switches.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2024
reviews.title: Life saver.

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: Stronger battery made no difference. The receiver does not get the signal even from 4 feet away unless the switch is removed from wall and pointed at it. In other words. This item is completely useless for its intended purpose. Spend a few $ more for something better.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
reviews.title: Poor distance

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: This product can be successfully used for installing a switch operating multiple lights, in my case located under multiple kitchen cabinets, without running cables in the walls. It is imperative to recognize that a distance between the switch and the receivers has to be minimized and tested, as the RF signal is not meant to penetrate through walls or over extended distances. Again, in my case, the best location for the receivers was above the switch or it would not pick up the signal on each attempt to turn the circuit on and off.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
reviews.title: A simple and effective solution for adding a switch operating multiple power cords

reviews.productTitle: Suraielec Wireless Remote Light Switch, No Wiring, No WiFi, 100ft RF Range, Pre-Programmed, Expandable Wireless Wall Switch and Receiver Kit, Remote Control Light Fixture for Lamp, Ceiling Light, Fan
reviews.text: My house is rather old and the ceiling light power box isn't connected to the wall switch in my room. instead of rewiring the romex to run through the light switch into the ceiling fixture, get this which will wirelessly switch on and off the ceiling light so you can get a smaller cordless ceiling light and use the remote to turn it on and off. the little housing of the circuit board is cumbersome and can take a little too much space in the ceiling box so I took the board out and it saved enough space so that I could get a thin ceiling light and still have it wirelessly connected. That being said, sometimes the remote can't reach the board and you'll have to aim the remote at certain spots to reach the controller but when it works, it works.
